content.description:
Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions.

When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must:

write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers.

AND

translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin.

Daedalus, ut fama est, fugiens Minoia regna,

praepetibus pennis ausus se credere caelo

insuetum per iter gelidas enavit ad Arctos,

Chalcidicaque levis tandem super astitit arce.

(5) Redditus his primum terris tibi, Phoebe, sacravit

remigiumÂ alarum posuitque immania templa.
content.question: Define apostrophe and identify an example of it in this passage. Write out the Latin that illustrates this figure of speech.

frqParts.text: Define apostrophe and identify an example of it in this passage. Write out the Latin that illustrates this figure of speech.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
